conclusion: Number of turns in the coil: m = 100, Coil's internal resistance: r = 10 Ω, External resistance: R = 90 Ω, Magnetic flux Φ varies sinusoidally with time, At t = 0, coil plane is parallel to the magnetic field
Flux varies sinusoidally with time, Period appears to be around 12.56 × 10⁻⁷ s, Amplitude of the flux is 2 × 10⁻⁷ Wb per turn
Flux through each turn can be expressed as Φ(t) = Φₘₐₓ sin(ωt), where Φₘₐₓ = 2 × 10⁻⁷ Wb
Determine period T as approximately 12.56 × 10⁻⁷ s, Calculate angular frequency ω = 5 × 10⁶ rad/s
EMF is given by Faraday's law: \(\mathcal{E} = -m \frac{d\Phi}{dt}\), For a single turn: \(\frac{d\Phi}{dt} = \Phi_{\text{max}} \omega \cos(\omega t)\)
For m = 100 turns, \(\mathcal{E} = -100 \times 2 \times 10^{-7} \times 5 \times 10^6 \cos(\omega t) = -10 \cos(\omega t) \text{ V}\)
Maximum value of EMF occurs when |cos(ωt)| = 1, so \(\mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = 10 \text{ V}\)
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 10 V
